raw_comment:
What do you notice?
I noticed that there was a jump down from 75% to 93%. I also noticed that there was a huge jump for that 0.1% of legacy and non-legacy applicants.
What do you wonder?
I wonder how many people fall within the range of 75% to 93%. Additionally, I wonder what would happen if the graph were on a different scale, like the log scale. 
How does this relate to you and your community?
One thing I wonder is what percentile does my community fall under. I believe my community is wealthier, and believe my community falls in the 90% range. 
Create a catchy headline that captures the graphâ€™s main idea.

"Legacy Vs. Admissions. A Battle Incoming College Students have to Face!"
ace_sentences: I notice a jump down from 75% to 93%.
I notice a huge jump for 0.1% of legacy applicants and non-legacy applicants.
I wonder how many people fall within the range from 75% to 93%.
I wonder what would happen if the graph were on a different scale.
A log scale is a different scale.
I wonder what would happen if the graph were on a log scale.
You ask how this relates to me and my community.
I wonder what percentile my community falls under.
I believe that my community is wealthier.
I believe that my community falls in the 90% range.
The headline is: "A battle incoming college students have to face".
